column1: yunque is the number twelve (12) in Quenya.
It is a composite from yú + ence "double six". PQ form given also as yu-(e)neke > yunuk(w)
Note that both ence and yunce were later changed to enque and yunque due to the influence of minquë. After that
column2: yunque is perceived as yú + enque

column1: An earlier word for "twelve" was rasta
column3: note 6. seen in the word yúrasta "24; double-12".

column1: It was also supported by the stem RÁSAT.Helge Fauskanger
